title: Understanding Gibbs Free Energy
text: The Gibbs free energy change ΔG for a process is given by the equation: ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - T ΔS , where ΔH is the enthalpy change, T is the temperature in Kelvin, and ΔS is the entropy change.

title: Units Consistency
text:
Consider the units:
- ΔH is given in $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$ $$(40.79$$ kJ/mol).
- ΔS is given in $$ rac{J}{K·mol}$$ $$(109.2$$ J/(K·mol)).
- Convert ΔH into J (1 kJ $$=$$ $$1000$$ J) to match the units of ΔS .

title: Convert Enthalpy to J
text: Convert the molar enthalpy of vaporization of water from $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ to $$\frac{J}{mol}$$.

title: Calculate Gibbs Free Energy
text: Now use the values ΔH $$=$$ $$40790$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ and ΔS $$=$$ $$109.2$$ $$\frac{J}{K·mol}$$ along with the temperature T $$=$$ $$350$$ K in the equation ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - T ΔS . Calculate ΔG .
